wikipedia_page.main: William John Arnold (1 March 1900 – 1977) was an English professional footballer of the 1920s. Born in Bromley, he joined Gillingham in 1922 and scored a goal on his debut against Swansea Town on 30 September of that year. He played again in the club's next match a week later but then never appeared for the first team again.

response: *William Arnold (settler) (1587–1676), one of the founding settlers in Rhode Island
*William Arnold (architect) (fl. 1595–1637), master mason in Somerset, England
